raw.title: V3 Borrow Cap Recommendations (Fast-track)
raw.author: 0xbC540e0729B732fb14afA240aA5A047aE9ba7dF0
raw.body:
## Summary
A proposal to add Borrow Caps for seven (7) uncapped assets and amend the Borrow Cap of nine (9) assets across four (4) chains in v3.

This proposal follows the fast-track process for increasing borrow caps as outlined [here](https://governance.aave.com/t/arc-v3-supply-borrow-cap-management-fast-track-process/8045).

## Motivation
In continuation of the successful vote on [V3 Supply Cap Recommendations for Uncapped Assets](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0xf40a7b4a6ecd5325553593f0f9fdc8ba04808573fdf76fc277aee52b5396a588), Chaos Labs proposes to add Borrow Caps to V3 assets, using the [AAVE V3 Borrow Caps Methodology](https://governance.aave.com/t/aave-v3-borrow-caps-methodology/10925).

This ARC will focus on assets that are currently not utilizing e-mode.

## Recommendations
 #### Avalanche

cleaned.title: Should nine (9) total risk parameters across seven (7) Aave V2 assets be updated?
cleaned.author: 0xDD659911EcBD4458db07Ee7cDdeC79bf8F859AbC

raw.title: Should nine (9) total risk parameters across seven (7) Aave V2 assets be updated?
raw.author: 0xDD659911EcBD4458db07Ee7cDdeC79bf8F859AbC
raw.body:
## Simple Summary

A proposal to adjust nine (9) total risk parameters across seven (7) Aave V2 assets including LTV, Liquidation Threshold, and Liquidation Bonus. 

## Abstract
This proposal is a batch update of risk parameters to align with the the [Moderate risk level](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/QmT9T4Rfnh1Z2HYmMPXvtFotMK2vSxiXK8dKStg2b6n4gi) chosen by the Aave community. These parameter updates are a continuation of Gauntlet's regular parameter recommendations.


## Motivation


This set of parameter updates seeks to maintain the overall risk tolerance of the protocol while making risk trade-offs between specific assets.


## Specification

This past week did not see outsized changes in market conditions nor within the Aave protocol. There were slight volatility drops and increases in trading volume and liquidity for most assets. Our platform recommends the following set of parameter changes that will decrease liquidation bonuses on several less-utilized assets.

| Parameter | Current Value | Recommended Value |
| -------- | -------- | -------- |
| BAL Liquidation Bonus     | 8.0%     | 7.5%     |
| CRV Loan To Value   | 45%     | 55%     |
| DPI Loan To Value     | 65%     | 70%     |
| DPI Liquidation Bonus     | 8.5%     | 7.5%     |
| DPI Liquidation Threshold    | 70%     | 75%     |
| ENJ Loan To Value    | 60%     | 70%     |
| MANA Loan To Value    | 65%     | 70%     |
| MKR Liquidation Bonus     | 8.0%     | 7.5%     |
| UNI Liquidation Bonus     | 8.0%     | 7.5%     |





## Risk Dashboard



The community should use Gauntlet's [Risk Dashboard](https://gov.gauntlet.network/aave) to better understand the updated parameter suggestions and general market risk in Aave V2. 



![](https://i.imgur.com/q8uyBaE.png)





## Next Steps

* Targeting an AIP on 2022-01-05

decision.summary: This proposal recommends risk parameter changes on Aave V3 markets, focusing on supply and borrow caps adjustments primarily for AVAX and ETH V3 assets to proactively manage liquidity and mitigate risk following recent market events. It is supported by timeline vote analysis, market impact data, and community forum feedback.
key_arguments_for: Early and consistent lead for 'YAE' in the voting timeline with strong stability and early participation metrics indicates clear community support.
Market impact analysis shows a moderate positive price impact (+1.26%) despite a slight TVL decline, supporting the proposal's effectiveness in risk mitigation.
Similar past proposals with comparable risk parameter adjustments have been successfully implemented, contributing to protocol stability without adverse market reactions.
Forum discussion supports the changes, especially for USDC, DAI.e, and WAVAX caps, with detailed rationale emphasizing protection against price manipulation and insolvencies.
key_arguments_against: Some community members view the aggressive supply caps on bridged assets like BTC.b and WETH.e as draconian, potentially driving liquidity to venues without such caps.
Concerns that certain assets are treated uniformly despite different liquidity and bridging characteristics, possibly limiting protocol growth unnecessarily.
The slight decline in TVL (-2.08%) might indicate some negative effect on liquidity or user engagement, raising caution about over-constraining caps.

evidence.quote: Forum sentiment shows mixed but largely neutral to positive views with key posts supporting risk mitigation measures and some critique on bridged asset caps.
Timeline metrics indicate unanimous early vote lead for 'YAE' with 100% stability and early ratio, reflecting decisive early voter confidence.

evidence.reference: Past proposals [ARC] Gauntlet Interest Rate Curve Recommendations for Aave V3 Markets (Feb 2023) and [ARC] Gauntlet Risk Parameter Updates for Avalanche Aave V3 (Feb 2023)
evidence.quote: These similar proposals recommended risk parameter changes with successful vote outcomes favoring 'YAE' and post-vote market stability.

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• The timeline voting pattern shows overwhelming early and stable support for 'YAE', indicating clear community endorsement of the proposed risk parameter changes.
• Forum sentiment, while mixed with some critical views on bridged asset caps, predominantly supports the proposal's goal to mitigate risk and improve protocol stability, aligning with the recommendation.
• Similar historical proposals with analogous changes were successful and did not trigger negative market or TVL outcomes, providing a precedent for effectiveness.
• Market impact data suggests a positive token price reaction despite a slight TVL decline, supporting the prudence of the proposed changes.
• The recommendation mirrors aggregated forum sentiment, reflecting community consensus despite some dissenting opinions about specific asset cap aggressiveness.
